title: Qubit State Normalization
statement: Every pure qubit state is represented by a unit vector in the complex Hilbert space ℂ². That is, if a qubit is in state |ψ⟩ = α|0⟩ + β|1⟩, then |α|² + |β|² = 1.

title: Superposition Principle
statement: If |ψ₁⟩ and |ψ₂⟩ are valid quantum states in a Hilbert space, then any normalized linear combination α|ψ₁⟩ + β|ψ₂⟩ is also a valid quantum state.

title: Unitary Evolution
statement: The time evolution of a closed quantum system is represented by a unitary operator U, such that the final state is U|ψ⟩ and preserves the norm.

title: No Cloning Theorem
statement: There does not exist a unitary operator U such that for all normalized states |ψ⟩, U(|ψ⟩⊗|0⟩) = |ψ⟩⊗|ψ⟩.

title: Measurement Postulate
statement: Measuring a quantum system in an orthonormal basis {|i⟩} collapses the state |ψ⟩ = ∑ αᵢ|i⟩ to state |j⟩ with probability |αⱼ|².

title: Tensor Product Structure
statement: The Hilbert space of a composite system is the tensor product of the Hilbert spaces of its subsystems.

title: Hadamard Gate Involution
statement: The Hadamard gate H satisfies H² = I, where I is the identity operator on ℂ².

title: CNOT Gate Reversibility
statement: The CNOT gate is unitary and its own inverse, satisfying CNOT · CNOT = I.

title: Entanglement Non-separability
statement: A quantum state |ψ⟩ ∈ ℂ²⊗ℂ² is entangled if it cannot be written as a tensor product |ψ₁⟩⊗|ψ₂⟩.

title: Bell State Maximal Entanglement
statement: The Bell state |Φ⁺⟩ = (|00⟩ + |11⟩)/√2 is a maximally entangled state of two qubits.

title: Quantum No Deletion Theorem
statement: There is no physical operation that takes two identical quantum states and deletes one copy without affecting the other.

title: Quantum Teleportation Correctness
statement: Quantum teleportation allows the transmission of an arbitrary qubit state using a maximally entangled pair and classical communication, preserving the original state on the receiver's side.

title: QFT Linearity
statement: The Quantum Fourier Transform is a linear and unitary transformation acting on basis states by mapping |x⟩ to (1/√N) ∑_{y=0}^{N−1} e^{2πixy/N} |y⟩.

title: Unitarity of Quantum Gates
statement: Every valid quantum gate must be represented by a unitary matrix.

title: Phase Kickback in Controlled Gates
statement: Applying a controlled-U gate to a control qubit in superposition causes the eigenphase of U to be transferred to the control qubit.

title: Grover Iteration Amplifies Target
statement: In Grover's algorithm, each iteration increases the amplitude of the target state quadratically in the number of iterations.

title: Deutsch-Jozsa Algorithm Correctness
statement: The Deutsch-Jozsa algorithm distinguishes between constant and balanced Boolean functions with one query, assuming a deterministic oracle.

title: Shor's Algorithm Period Finding
statement: Shor’s algorithm efficiently finds the period of the modular exponentiation function f(x) = a^x mod N with high probability.

title: Quantum Parallelism
statement: Quantum circuits can evaluate a function f on a superposition of inputs simultaneously due to linearity of quantum evolution.

title: Monogamy of Entanglement
statement: If two qubits are maximally entangled with each other, they cannot be entangled with a third system.

title: Pauli Matrices Anticommutation
statement: The Pauli matrices X, Y, Z satisfy anticommutation relations: {X,Y} = 0, {Y,Z} = 0, and {Z,X} = 0.

title: Eigenvalues of Observables
statement: In quantum mechanics, observables are Hermitian operators whose eigenvalues represent measurable quantities.

title: Non-commutativity Implies Uncertainty
statement: If two observables A and B do not commute, then the system exhibits an uncertainty relation between them.

title: Unitarity of QFT Circuit
statement: The quantum Fourier transform circuit implements a unitary transformation, preserving inner product structure.

title: Swap Gate Decomposability
statement: The SWAP gate can be decomposed into three CNOT gates: SWAP = CNOT · Toffoli · CNOT.

title: Trace Preservation of CPTP Maps
statement: Any completely positive trace-preserving (CPTP) map preserves the trace of a density operator under its evolution.

title: Density Matrix Positivity
statement: Any valid quantum density matrix ρ must be Hermitian, positive semidefinite, and have trace equal to 1.

title: Purification Theorem
statement: Every mixed quantum state can be represented as the partial trace of a pure state on a larger Hilbert space.

title: Partial Trace Linear Operator
statement: The partial trace operation is linear and maps operators on a composite Hilbert space to operators on a subsystem.

title: Post-selection Bias
statement: Conditioning on a post-selected measurement outcome alters the statistics of future measurements and may introduce non-causal correlations.
